body.directions: Listen to the audio, then complete the multiple choice questions that follow.

body.textVersion: Audio for 你从哪里来？ Nǐ cóng nǎlǐ lái?

body.quiz: Which of the following would be a good response to the question from the audio?
body.answer: Audio for 我从 Florida 来。 Wǒ cóng Florida lái.
options: Audio for 早上好 zǎoshàng hǎo
Audio for 我叫 Lily. Wǒ jiào Lili.
Audio for 我姓 Smith. Wǒ xìng Smith.
body.correct: You nailed it! The question “你从哪里来？Nǐ cóng nǎlǐ lái?” is asking where you are from. The response should use the structure “我从…来. Wǒ cóng…lái.” (I am from…).
body.incorrect: Very close. Please try to listen to the audio again. Pay attention to the syllables, and listen to it several times if needed.

body.textVersion: Audio for 你呢? Nǐ ne?

body.quiz: Which of the following is an English phrase that’s similar to the question in the audio?
body.correct: You got it! 你呢? Nǐ ne? means “What about you?” The word 呢 ne prompts a “what about” question.
body.incorrect: Not quite. Try listening to the audio one more time. Pay attention to the second syllable and think about what kind of word it is.

body.textVersion: Audio for 你住在哪里？ Nǐ zhùzài nǎlǐ?

body.quiz: Which of the following can be given as response to the question in the audio?
body.correct: Excellent job! The question 你住在哪里? Nǐ zhùzài nǎlǐ? means “Where do you live?”
body.incorrect: So close! Please listen again and pay attention to the second part “zhùzài.”

body.textVersion: Audio for 他/她/它 tā

body.quiz: Which of the following does this word not represent?
body.correct: Wonderful job! The pinyin tā corresponds to three different singular pronouns 他(he), 她(she), and 它(it).

body.quiz: In what situation would you use this word?
body.answer: When I want to state a fact
options: When I want to deny something
When I want to disagree with someone
When I want to express my excitement
body.correct: You got it! 是 shì means “to be” to state a fact, just like “is,” “am,” “are,” “was,” and “were” in English.
body.incorrect: Not quite. Think about what type of word this is. You can refer to your notes for more information.
